turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Geraldine O'Brien.
turn.2: Geraldine O'Brien Geraldine O'Brien (27 February 1922 – 3 July 2014) was an Irish botanical illustrator.
turn.4: She was born Geraldine Mary O'Brien on 27 February 1922, to parents Donough Richard O'Brien and distinguished artist Cicely Maud Carus-Wilson.
turn.5: Did she do anything other than illustrations?
turn.6: She was cousin to both the artist Dermod O'Brien PRHA and President of the Watercolour Society Kitty Wilmer O'Brien RHA.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: O'Brien was educated in Dublin where she won prizes in the international competitions of London's Royal Drawing Society.
turn.9: Did she work with anyone else?
turn.10: At 17 she spent a year in West Cornwall with Stanhope Alexander Forbes and at 18 she took part in her first exhibition at the Royal Hibernian Academy.
turn.11: What did she do during the Second World War?
turn.12: It became difficult to study internationally with the outbreak of the Second World War, and O'Brien took the opportunity to use her skills for the war effort and turned to mechanical drawing.
